title: The Bachelorette's 'Dirty Jess' breaks down as he's told to resign
text:
The Bachelorette's Jess Glasgow has been told to resign as a local Noosa councillor after being slammed for his sexist behaviour on the dating show.

Speaking on The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Friday, the politician became emotional as he revealed how his career had spectacularly fallen apart in just 48 hours.

Reflecting on his controversial remarks, which fans have labelled 'disgusting' and 'vile', he said: 'I'm actually shaking. I'm totally not happy at myself and I do not applaud any of [my] actions.'

Under fire: The Bachelorette's Jess Glasgow (pictured) has been told to resign as a local Noosa councillor after being slammed for his sexist behaviour on the dating show

He added: 'It's so out of context and I want to make it known I'm not a reality TV guy... I just took it too far and I totally made a poor judgement. It's reality TV, you don't get a second chance. It's "bang" and it's out there.'

After radio host Jackie 'O' Henderson asked Jess if he'd watched Thursday's episode, he said: '[Yes], until I started cringing and throwing up.'

Later in the interview, Jess said that 'everybody hates [him]' at Noosa council and his fledgling political career is now at risk.

Dumped: The local politician was sent home on Thursday's episode of The Bachelorette, after Angie Kent (pictured) confronted him over his inappropriate behaviour

He revealed: 'The Mayor rang me this morning at 5:30 and said, "Jess, I'm going to put out a press release. You should be looking at resigning".'

After Jess' interview, Angie called KIIS FM and made it clear she 'didn't ask for him to lose his job' and just wanted to hold him to account for his behaviour.

Meanwhile, Noosa Mayor Tony Wellington told Nova FM's Fitzy and Wippa that he has encouraged Jess to resign from his position as a local councillor.

'It was a rather extreme example of Cr Glasgow's behaviour and it's most disappointing to me and to many other people across Noosa and I'm sure across the country,' Mr Wellington said.

Angie's brutal farewell During Thursday's episode of The Bachelorette, Angie Kent said that Jess 'gave [her] the creeps' during their group date. But she didn't confront him until learning that he had also made female crew members uncomfortable with his persistent flirting. During their showdown at the cocktail party, Angie told Jess: 'You made me feel very uncomfortable at the photo shoot. I said I wanted fun, but I feel like you took it too far. 'I will never allow a man to come in and f**k with my sisterhood. Never. 'I feel like you think this is a joke, and that really annoys me. You never talk about me as a person. You always just talk about me as a piece of meat.' 'I don't trust you and I'm sorry, you're gonna have to leave': Angie scolded Jess for being a creep, telling him he 'took [things] too far' during their group date As Jess interrupted to apologise for 'acting inappropriately', Angie snapped: 'I really don't believe a word that you say. 'I don't trust you and I'm sorry, you're gonna have to leave.' After packing his bags and being driven away in the limousine, Jess denied any wrongdoing. 'Apparently I was a bit crude to her on the photo shoot. That's bulls**t,' he said. 'Apparently that was too sexualising. I don't know. Obviously, it's just a different of opinion. I know deep down nothing happened.' He then added: 'I'm going back to Noosa to find the love of my life in a dirty, dingy nightclub.'

'That sort of misogynistic, crude, offensive behaviour is just not on.

'He certainly wasn't acting on behalf of Noosa council on the show, but he did reference his role on Noosa council which he shouldn't have done, and made in fact some play of the fact he was a politician on the Noosa council.'

Mr Wellington explained that because Jess is an elected representative and not an employee of the council 'he can't be fired'.

But he has nonetheless asked Jess to resign, saying: 'I'll be speaking with Jess about his future on the council. I don't see that he has a future on our council.

'I did speak to him this morning and I told him that my recommendation to him was that he resign from his position as councillor on the Noosa Council.

'He is under the belief that he can brave it out, shall we say... he thinks that it's not as dramatic as some of the reactions I've been receiving.'

Jess later told Fitzy & Wippa that he was deeply sorry for what he'd done, describing his actions as 'despicable' and a 'mistake'.

'I'm naturally a little bit of a flirtatious guy [but] I'm truly sorry. Angie deserves a hell of a lot better than that, every woman does,' he said.

'It's been a terrible 24 hours. As you can imagine, it's World War 3.

'Absolutely I cringed, it's not me at all, it's reality TV. I sincerely apologise, I never ever meant to have those words come out that way.'

Jess also claimed he did not remember calling Angie a 'b***h' at the cocktail party, despite being caught using the slur on camera.

He said: 'Well, in the cocktail parties you forget that everything's being filmed.'

Radio host Ryan 'Fitzy' Fitzgerald noted that Jess sounded 'shattered' on the phone, but the embattled Sunshine Coast councillor said he was hopeful his career will survive.

'This isn't me, I'm not this guy and I know that. I hold women's rights dearly to my heart,' he said.

Jess was sent home on Thursday's episode of The Bachelorette, after Angie Kent confronted him over his inappropriate behaviour.

Fans across the country have slammed the 37-year-old politician, taking to Twitter to label him 'disgusting', 'creepy' and 'vile'.

During the episode, Jess made crude sexual remarks about Angie, called her a 'b**ch' and flirted awkwardly with female crew members.

'You should be looking at resigning': Noosa Mayor Tony Wellington (pictured) revealed on Friday morning that he had told Jess to resign from his position as a local councillor

Angie: 'Why Jess shouldn't be fired' Speaking on The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Friday, Angie said that Jess shouldn't lose his job over the scandal. After listening to audio of Jess' grovelling on-air apology, she said: 'I'm not asking him to lose his job, I just stuck up for myself and other women he was making uncomfortable. 'When I heard he made other women feel uncomfortable, that's when I saw red. I don't want him to be online bullied, I can't stand that.' Angie added that she hopes Jess will 'learn' from the experience and treat women with more respect going forward. 'I'm not asking him to lose his job': Speaking on The Kyle and Jackie O Show on Friday, Angie (pictured) said that Jess should not resign from Noosa council over the scandal

'Oh my God, Jess is absolutely revolting. I feel physically sick watching his antics as the horse. Appropriate conduct towards women @NoosaCouncil?' one viewer wrote.

'"Wandering fingers", seriously? This is not putting Noosa in a good light, Jess,' another person tweeted.

A similar comment read: 'Jess is everything we teach our sons not to be and that person we want to protect our daughters from.'

Twitter backlash: During Thursday's episode, Jess made crude sexual remarks about Angie, called her a 'b**ch' and flirted awkwardly with female crew members

During a farmyard-themed photo shoot on Thursday's episode, Jess was dressed as the backside of a horse when he 'joked' that Angie was going to 'ride' him.

He later positioned his head close to Angie's bottom and proceeded to poke his tongue out and make rude sexual gestures.

In another cringeworthy moment, he brazenly told her: 'Don't mind me if I get some wandering fingers, alright?'

'I feel physically sick': Bachelorette viewers have described Jess as 'absolutely revolting'

His behaviour didn't go unnoticed in the mansion, with the other male contestants labeling him 'sleazy', 'inappropriate', and 'a dead set f**king womaniser'.

After Carlin Sterritt informed Angie about the situation, she angrily confronted Jess before sending him home.

Fans praised Angie for how she handled herself, with one person tweeting: 'You go girl! Super proud of someone standing up for women with men like Jess around!'

'Won't miss him': Many women said they had a visceral reaction to Jess' sexist behaviour

Another fan wrote: 'Angie, thank you for standing up to that gaslighting, sleazy [guy]. And good on all the guys for calling out his vile behaviour.'

A third person added: 'You go, girl. Props to Angie looking out for the sisterhood.'

Despite the overwhelming support for Angie, one viewer pointed out that it was unfair of the producers to allow Jess' behaviour to escalate to that level.

Show of support! Angie was widely praised on Twitter for how she handled the situation

'It is awesome that Angie told him off and sent him on his disgusting way, but why did she have to do it?' they tweeted.

'Shouldn't he have been booted by the producers the second he harassed anyone? Not as good TV I know, but why let him stay a second longer?'

Another wrote: 'If Jess was being inappropriate to the staff, Channel 10 should have acted before it got to this stage. Nobody deserves to be sexually harassed at their workplace.'

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel 10 for comment.

Not happy! Despite the overwhelming support for Angie, one viewer pointed out that it was unfair of the producers to allow Jess' behaviour to escalate to that level

In a statement to 10 Daily, Jess said he meant 'no disrespect' to Angie or the crew, and apologised for causing any offence.

He said: 'It was not my intention to bring the Noosa Council or Noosa people into disrepute. I had the opportunity to find love on this show and I went for it.

'I must admit, I'm a flirtatious guy, but I meant no disrespect.'

Too far: During a farmyard-themed photo shoot on Thursday's episode, Jess was dressed as the backside of a horse when he 'joked' that Angie was going to 'ride' him. He later positioned his head next to Angie's bottom and proceeded to poke his tongue out and make rude gestures

He was less apologetic in an interview with News Corp, in which he insisted his words had been 'totally taken out of context'.

'It was all just jest, in the moment-type behaviour,' he said. 'I never said anything in a derogatory-type, insensitive way towards [Angie].

'People forget, we're filming TV here. I don't know if you've noticed but their ratings are through the roof because of this thing.'

Disgusting: In another cringeworthy moment, he brazenly told Angie, 'Don't mind me if I get some wandering fingers, alright?'

Meanwhile, Jess is now under investigation for a potential breach of conduct as a result of his behaviour the dating show.

Mayor Wellington issued a statement on Thursday saying that Jess does not reflect Noosa Council or the town's community values.

'Cr Glasgow did not seek approval from myself and I only found out about his involvement after the show had been recorded,' Mr Wellington said.

'He's a dead set f**king womaniser!' Jess' behaviour didn't go unnoticed in the mansion, with the other male contestants labeling him 'sleazy' and 'inappropriate'

Mr Wellington also told Ben Fordham on 2GB radio that he found Jess' behaviour 'difficult to watch'.

'He accepts the fact that he made some errors of judgment, he accepts the fact that he will now be referred to the independent assessor and he takes full responsibility of his action, but I am not sure he is fully aware of the long term repercussions,' he said.

When Fordham asked what Jess was like in a workplace setting, the Mayor replied: 'He is one of our more unusual councillors, I'll put it that way.'
description: The Bachelorette's Jess Glasgow has been told to resign as a local Noosa councillor after being slammed for his sexist behaviour on the dating show.
authors: Jo Scrimshire For Daily Mail Australia
